connector.description: Validate the payload using XML Schema and JAXP Validation.

camel.sink.path.resourceUri.name: camel.sink.path.resourceUri
camel.sink.path.resourceUri.description: URL to a local resource on the classpath, or a reference to lookup a bean in the Registry, or a full URL to a remote resource or resource on the file system which contains the XSD to validate against.

camel.sink.endpoint.failOnNullBody.name: camel.sink.endpoint.failOnNullBody
camel.sink.endpoint.failOnNullBody.description: Whether to fail if no body exists.

camel.sink.endpoint.failOnNullHeader.name: camel.sink.endpoint.failOnNullHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.failOnNullHeader.description: Whether to fail if no header exists when validating against a header.

camel.sink.endpoint.headerName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.headerName
camel.sink.endpoint.headerName.description: To validate against a header instead of the message body.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.errorHandler.name: camel.sink.endpoint.errorHandler
camel.sink.endpoint.errorHandler.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.processor.validation.ValidatorErrorHandler. The default error handler captures the errors and throws an exception.

camel.sink.endpoint.resourceResolver.name: camel.sink.endpoint.resourceResolver
camel.sink.endpoint.resourceResolver.description: To use a custom LSResourceResolver. Do not use together with resourceResolverFactory

camel.sink.endpoint.resourceResolverFact.name: camel.sink.endpoint.resourceResolverFactory
camel.sink.endpoint.resourceResolverFact.description: To use a custom LSResourceResolver which depends on a dynamic endpoint resource URI. The default resource resolver factory resturns a resource resolver which can read files from the class path and file system. Do not use together with resourceResolver.

camel.sink.endpoint.schemaLanguage.name: camel.sink.endpoint.schemaLanguage
camel.sink.endpoint.schemaLanguage.description: Configures the W3C XML Schema Namespace URI.

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.useSharedSchema.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useSharedSchema
camel.sink.endpoint.useSharedSchema.description: Whether the Schema instance should be shared or not. This option is introduced to work around a JDK 1.6.x bug. Xerces should not have this issue.

camel.component.validator.lazyStartProdu.name: camel.component.validator.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.validator.lazyStartProdu.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.validator.autowiredEnabl.name: camel.component.validator.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.validator.autowiredEnabl.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.validator.resourceResolv.name: camel.component.validator.resourceResolverFactory
camel.component.validator.resourceResolv.description: To use a custom LSResourceResolver which depends on a dynamic endpoint resource URI
